fields.description: Since this page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Documentation has specific links to Planning Board, Task Board, Chart Board and Released Board, would it be a good idea to add a link to the docs on Rapid Board ?
fields.summary: Add a link to the Rapid Board  on the top level GreenHopper documentation page

fields.description:
Hello team,
We noticed a bug when we release a sprint in the rapid board and we go after see the sprint report of that sprint, the number of story points that we have for the issues are the one that were originally been inserted. We want to know why it doesn't show the number of story point of the issue when we release the sprint?

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Create one story and set _X_ story points.
* Move the story to "Done" and edit the story points to _Y_ on Resolve Issue screen.
* Close the sprint and go to Sprint Report.

You'll note that the report will show  _X_ story points instead of _Y_, which was the value that we edited before closing the issue.

Please let us know if this is an expected behavior or if it's indeed a bug.
Thanks!
fields.summary: Story Points on Rapid Board Sprint report are not accurate

fields.description: We would like to be able to add fields to a card displayed in the RapidBoard. We assign a business value (i.e.: priority) for the work on our list. I'd like the Business Value to be displayed on the board so we can keep track of where the most important things are in the process.
fields.summary: Edit fields on Cards

fields.description:
The error is still there, I think it's a bug. What I did:
1. Add a column in the rapid board
2. Associate the column with a issue state
3. delete the issue state which I earlier associated with the column

I guess, the "configure rapid board view" tries to resolve all associated issue states and doesn't handle deleted states.
fields.summary: Cannot configure a Rapid Board after deleting one of the statuses included in a column
. click a card in the rapid board, then quickly use the...

fields.description:
Statistics Burndown Chart's guideline start 1 day earlier than start date.

This will cause the burndown line to be above the guideline from the start.

!stats_burndown_chart.png|thumbnail!

The guideline from the above shows that the guideline start from 13th but the start data is actually 14th.
fields.summary: Statistics Burndown Chart's guideline start 1 day earlier than start date

fields.description:
Clicking twice can create two views instead of one.

Expected: disable create button while ajax request is ongoing

fields.description:
See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4584

Basically, if the Rank field is hidden, ranking doesn't quite work. Nobody ever complains though, and worst, RankResource happily performs a rerank without telling the user that actually nothing got reranked.

Also not clear to me: AO stuff is actually not updated (I first thought this would only have an influence on the issue index/sorting).

1. Make RankResource blow up in this case
2. Show proper error message on Rapid Board AND classic boards in this case
fields.summary: Ranking passes without error in case Rank field is hidden -> huge support pain
As a user, I'd like the manage Rapid Board screen to have a clear 'Create new board' button directly on the screen rather than being hidden in a submenu

fields.description: in the Time-Tracking Analysis the words for time are spelled out i.e. hours, minutes, etc... how come they don't follow the JIRA shorthand convention of w/d/h/m/s? they take up a ton of screen real estate that could make that sceen much more easily readable
fields.summary: Change the time-tracking analysis to use w/d/h/m/s

fields.description:
Statistic fields validations cause support pain, because we throw Exceptions without providing a way to clean the data up. Tasks

1. Check all our DAOs, fall back to reasonable values where possible. None for column constraints, issue count for estimation statistic, etc.
2. Warn instead of throwing an error
3. Test that we can run GH with only the rapid view table configured (manually delete all other AO tables), and ensure that GH won't blow anywhere, and that we can use the configuration to bring GH back into a consistent state
fields.summary: Don't throw exceptions with invalid data, EVER, try to recover gracefully and log whatever you can

fields.description:
This is most noticeable with large instances of JIRA, but when creating a rapid board, there is no indication that the request is being processed.  There is no loading marker, or indication from the browser that it is loading.   Example screenshot:
!creating rapid board without any load notification.png|thumbnail!

Best case would be to improve the performance for larger instances, but it would be helpful to have some like this example load indicator:
!example load indicator.png!
fields.summary: Creating a Rapid Board has no indication that it is processing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5283].
  {panel}

When adding sub-tasks with estimations, the Estimation field in the Plan and Work mode are not cumulative. 

Steps:
1- Add a Story to back log.
2- Add a Sub Task with 8hrs estimate to that Story
3- Notice that on the Sprint Marker the "Estimate" field is not updated. Same for the Template view on the right side..

- If you open the Story outside of the Rapid Board then the time tracking is cumulative.  

- Refer to attachment for a screenshot. The screenshot does not show the Original Estimation for the Sub Task, but it is set to 8hrs.
fields.summary: Time estimates for sub tasks are not added to the total estimate of a Story in the Plan and Work view.

fields.description:
Hello team,

We would like to suggest a feature request to allow GreenHopper use the remaining hours as the estimation unit. 
This is useful to track whether each team member has his plate full. Using original estimates don't work since most of the issues that customer can have span across multiple weeks to solve. 
Sure original estimates provides better guideline for product management, but this way users canto up developer performance.
Please let us know your thoughts.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Use Remaining Hours as time estimation unit on Rapid Boards

fields.description:
As a logged-out user I want to click on Greenhopper links (e.g. in my browser's bookmarks). Jira should then prompt me for my credentials and redirect me to that page (e.g. to the Burndown chart).
Currently I will not be asked for my credentials. Instead a "Getting Started with Greenhopper" page is being shown.

See also JSP-126480
fields.summary: Logged out users should be prompted for credentials and redirected

fields.description: Some customers will be measuring cycle time in minutes, hours, days, or weeks. For those users that don't use days, they may be stuck at the moment with stupid numbers like those attached.
fields.summary: As a Control Chart user, I want to be able to configure the time period so that I don't get ridiculous numbers
Logging twice work in the same minute will only show up once in the RB burndown
Investigate reducing number of javascript resources included on the rapidboard

fields.description:
Using GH causes new options to appear in the "More Options" section when viewing an issue (attached screenshots showing this). This is regardless of whether the project is listed in the "Enabled Projects" section in the GH configuration. This can be confusing for users who try to use these options.

One workaround is to remove the "Schedule Issues" project permission, but this still causes the "Planning Board", "Task Board" and "Rapid Board" options to appear.

It would be helpful to have an option to disable all GH links for specific projects.
fields.summary: Remove GH links in the More Actions section for specific projects
As a Rapid Board owner would need the ability to see subtasks in planning mode & add up the estimation.  further need the ability to only pick certain subtasks for a sprint

fields.description:
At the moment we perform three XHR calls in order to render a rapid board in series:

First we get the rapid board selector data.
Then we get the rapid board config data.
Finally we get the issues data (allData).

For the 99% case we should be able to perform all three of these calls in parallel (kick them all off at the same time), and just perform the rendering in series.

This will kill off the Rapid Board selection drop down

This means we will have to perform an additional two rest calls in the unlikely case where someone attempts to load a rapid board that has been deleted and gets punted to the default board.
fields.summary: Perform work modes initial XHR calls in parallel

fields.description:
GHJavaScriptData.jspa, being a <script> in head, is blocking rendering adding an extra half a second onto full page pop time on JAC from my home machine.

It became a catch-all for various bits and pieces, that can all be moved into the rapid board config call instead.
fields.summary: Nuke GHJavaScriptData.jspa from orbit

fields.description:
1. Open a rapid board, planning view
2. Click on any item in the list of items
3. The "pre-view" of the cliecked item is displayed to the right, but it's not possible to configure what fields to include in this display.

As we have some really important infromation in custom fields (e.g. the actual "user story" text 'As a Player I want to...'), we currently need to open all issues in new tabs anyway during planning - it's sufficient to only use the rapid board planning view.
fields.summary: As a Rapid board user I want to be able to select what fields that should be displayed in the "pre-view" (right column)

fields.description:
I'm not sure how it's supposed to work but I raised it as an issue over on https://support.atlassian.com/ (Id: JST-39290) and was asked to post it here instead.

I'd like to organize the Done column of the RapidBoard. As it is now the RapidBoard's Done column keeps increasing and readability is lost.

I have 3 ToDo, 2 In Progress, 1 in Test and 77 in Done.

Obviously I could remove the Done column but I still like them to be seen as Done a week so the requester can see them completed.

Perhaps it's already in RapidBoard and I'm just to new to GreenHopper, but I've tried googling and didn't find any help in the documentation with this.

We are currently using the On Demand 10 license for evaluating purposes. Any help would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Kanban - Done Done Done

fields.description:
The page here has a few things that need updating:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts

Rapid Board
Add a New Line is now just Enter for the Description and textareas. Shift-enter will also do this but before Enter would submit and that's why we called out shift-enter.
Projector mode in Rapid Board does not do any resizing now, it just changes contrast and reduces clutter.
Hide/Show Right Section should probably now refer to the Detail view for consistency.

New: Global:
Added G + H to go to wherever the Agile menu would take you = the last place you were.
fields.summary: Update Keyboard Shortcuts Page

fields.description:
This is the *story* to continue the work of the *spike* GHS-5221.

COS:
* All issue links for an issue are displayed inside the Details View
* The placement will be in the *Details* tab, at the bottom after other fields
* Local links will be displayed instantly
* Remote issue links will have a stub representation initially, and then will load asynchronously to get the latest information from their server of origin
* The user will be allowed to delete issue links from within the Details View, if they have the necessary permissions
* The user will see a button/affordance to create a new issue link, if they have the necessary permissions
* The visual representation of the links will attempt to match JIRA's representation of links found on the View Issue page (modified to suit the space constraints of the Detail View)

See comments for a discussion on what work remains to be done based on the progress of the spike.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see the Issue Links of an issue when using the Detail View

fields.description: See https://jdog.atlassian.net/browse/JRADEV-11751
fields.summary: HTML Title Tag attribute for My JIRA Home option not provided

fields.description: Hitting CTRL-R or equivalent to reload the pool is overkill, since it'll reload the whole page (which can take a bit, depending on latency, since _all_ static resources have to be 304-freshness-checked). Instead, it would be cool to have a keyboard shortcut that just kicks off the pool request again and updates my work mode.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a keyboard shortcut to refresh the pool on the work mode without reloading the whole page

fields.description: We have multiple custom fields in which we store data about our stories. We would like a way to configure the Plan mode of Rapid Board so that we can see and edit these fields in the right-side pane when the issue is selected.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to see additional custom fields in the right-side pane in Plan mode, so that I can make valid estimates based on the information in these fields.

fields.description: Downloaded JIRA 5.0.5 and tried installing GH through UPM (using the "try" option). After the plugin install, I'm getting an error message (see screenshot), although there are no errors in the logfile (upgrade tasks seem to have run successfully, there's also no data present).
fields.summary: GH fails to install through UPM

fields.description:
h3. Symptom(s)

When starting JIRA up, the following exceptions are presented within the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}
2012-05-22 12:26:34,080 Spring executor 9 ERROR anonymous 745x29x1 1nasxbp 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/Setup.jspa [plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] Unable to start the Spring context for plugin com
.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'pivotalRapidBoardManager' defined in URL [bundle://57.0:0/META-INF/spring/atlassian-plugins-components.x
ml]: Initialization of bean failed; nested exception is java.lang.TypeNotPresentException: Type com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rapid.view.Column not present
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.doCreateBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:480)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory$1.run(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:409)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.createBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:380)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory$1.getObject(AbstractBeanFactory.java:264)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry.getSingleton(DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry.java:222)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.doGetBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:261)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.getBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:185)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.getBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:164)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.DefaultListableBeanFactory.preInstantiateSingletons(DefaultListableBeanFactory.java:429)
        at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.finishBeanFactoryInitialization(AbstractApplicationContext.java:728)
        at org.springframework.osgi.context.support.AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.access$1600(AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.java:69)
        at org.springframework.osgi.context.support.AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext$4.run(AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.java:355)
        at org.springframework.osgi.util.internal.PrivilegedUtils.executeWithCustomTCCL(PrivilegedUtils.java:85)
        at org.springframework.osgi.context.support.AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.completeRefresh(AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.java:320)
        at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$CompleteRefreshTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:13
2)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1110)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:603)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)
Caused by: java.lang.TypeNotPresentException: Type com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rapid.view.Column not present
        at sun.reflect.generics.factory.CoreReflectionFactory.makeNamedType(CoreReflectionFactory.java:116)
        at sun.reflect.generics.visitor.Reifier.visitClassTypeSignature(Reifier.java:125)
        at sun.reflect.generics.tree.ClassTypeSignature.accept(ClassTypeSignature.java:49)
        at sun.reflect.generics.visitor.Reifier.reifyTypeArguments(Reifier.java:68)
        at sun.reflect.generics.visitor.Reifier.visitClassTypeSignature(Reifier.java:138)
        at sun.reflect.generics.tree.ClassTypeSignature.accept(ClassTypeSignature.java:49)
        at sun.reflect.generics.repository.MethodRepository.getReturnType(MethodRepository.java:68)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.getGenericReturnType(Method.java:254)
        at java.beans.FeatureDescriptor.getReturnType(FeatureDescriptor.java:368)
        at java.beans.Introspector.getTargetEventInfo(Introspector.java:1020)
        at java.beans.Introspector.getBeanInfo(Introspector.java:424)

{code}

h3. Cause

The likely cause is that JIRA is using OpenJDK, which is an unsupported JRE/JDK as in our [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms].

h3. Resolution

Install a supported version of Java, as in our [Installing Java|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java] documentation.

h3. More Info
From {{Unable to start the Spring context for plugin com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin}}, guessing that this is caused by JIM expecting GH to be on the classpath. Haven't tried if JIM actually works (I suspect it doesn't, since the spring context didn't come up). This might as well be a JIM bug.

Replication steps:
* downloaded JIRA 5.0.5 from WAC
* setup JIRA with default settings

fields.description:
COS:
* Pool/Backlog data will now return as part of the payload a list of projects contained in the issues. This data will be expanded upon in the future.
* This story will incorporate GHS-5217
* In the case where no issues are found in a backlog/pool, we determine recent projects by the query of the board
** If the query is not project-based, then we do not modify the project history
* Be smart about where projects get inserted into the history
* When viewing a Rapid Board via a gadget, this should not have an effect on the recent projects for the user


To be smart about history, consider the following example.

Viewing a board with issues from projects A, B, X and Y.

The issues are seen by the board (ordered by Rank), in the order X, A, B, Y.

The user's current history contains the projects in the following order (most recent first): D, B, A, F, G.

Because we do not want to upset the order of projects that were already in the history and that we have just seen, the desired new ordering of projects is as follows:
B, A, X, Y, D, F, G.
fields.summary: When a Rapid Board is shown, add the projects shown in issues to the most recently used list in JIRA

fields.description: Stay selected
fields.summary: When story moved to done column don't scroll to it
Sort status objects in column configuration to show non zero alphabetical, divider then zero alphabetical

fields.description:
- Styling for the Added items
- Third table for Removed items
- Styling for Added items do need to be possible in Removed table
fields.summary: Sprint Report should visually call out added and removed stories

fields.description:
The new Sprint field used by the Rapid board, separate from the Fix For Version, is great. 

However right now a big flaw with using it is that there is no convenient way to set it directly from the Edit Issue view (as opposed to using the Plan tab UI of the Rapid Board). This is often necessary - say there is a critical bug that needs to be filed and added to the current sprint, it would be nice to do it in a single shot rather than having to create it, find it on the rapid board and drag it into the sprint.

You can add the Sprint field to the Default issue screen, which makes it appear when Editing the issue, but this shows a text field where you have to enter the ID of the sprint. Since this is a system-level value that no user would ever know, its less than useful to non-power users. 

The ideal would be to enable the use of either a Select dropdown or an autocomplete-type editor a la fix for versions. I suspect this shouldn't be too hard to do, just allow the Autocomplete/Select renderer for the Sprint field.

If there is any workaround to get this working before it's released (say some sample plugin code) that could be posted this would be great.
fields.summary: Enable Select or Autocomplete Renderer for new Greenhopper Sprint field
Subtask estimates (both time and story points) to count towards my sprint marker estimates

fields.description:
For users getting started with GreenHopper and JIRA, it would be handy to allow them to create a new workflow as they define the columns of their Rapid Board, rather than have to create the workflow in advance. 

This would make it super quick and easy to get started using GH and JIRA, and avoid the more daunting aspects of workflow management. 

The more we can do intelligently behind the scenes, the better. Prompt to ask questions, like "You've tried to transition this issue to a workflow state that doen't have a transition defined - would you like to create one?"
fields.summary: Configure JIRA workflow by setting up Rapid Board columns
